text: Beijing‚Äôs strict ‚ÄúCovid-zero‚Äù rules have kept Chinese gamblers at home and caused Macau to fall behind Las Vegas in gambling revenue    https://t.co/T6tcam4jzt via @BW
label: General News | Opinion
llm_pred:
Macau's gambling revenue has been significantly impacted by Beijing's stringent "Covid-zero" policies, which have restricted travel and kept Chinese gamblers within the country, preventing them from visiting Macau. This has resulted in a notable shortfall compared to Las Vegas, which has seen a stronger recovery in gaming revenues as travel restrictions eased globally. The ongoing situation underscores how public health policies can directly influence regional economic performance, particularly in tourism-dependent economies like Macau.
